com.nokia.sm.net
Class ServerComm

java.lang.Object
  com.nokia.sm.net.ServerComm
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class ServerComm
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable

This class facilitates communication between a game client and a SNAP Mobile server. It provides methods for accessing online multiplayer game and community features such as instant messaging, chat, presence management, buddy list (or friends list), versatile matchmaking, and ranking.

Instances of this class provide a network protocol agnostic implementation. This means the implementation does not depend on the underlying network protocol. At present, HTTP and TCP are the only supported protocols, but other protocols may be added in the future.

SNAP Mobile servers generate events for certain actions that take place, such as creating new lobbies or game rooms, chat messages delivered to a particular user, and so on. These events are held on the server until retrieved by the client. This class supports two approaches for retrieving the events. Clients can retrieve events synchronously, at a time of their choosing, by calling a method such as retrieveAllEvents(). Alternatively, a client can register as a listener for SNAP events by calling addSnapEventListener(). In this case, ServerComm will retrieve events asynchronously behind the scenes, and call back into the client when new events are available. Both approaches have their advantages and drawbacks.

Many of the methods in this class return an instance of ItemList. If an error occurs during execution of the requested action, the returned ItemList will have the following structure:

Name Type
errorCode Integer
errorMessage String
additional String

The errorCode can be validated against the SnapEventListener fields *_ERROR_CODE like this: 

public void login(ServerComm comm, String name, String password, gcid) throws Exception {
      ItemList loginInfo = comm.extendedLogin(name, password, gcid, null);
      int errorCode = -1;
      String errorMessage = "";
      if(loginInfo != null) {
          Integer error = loginInfo.getInteger("errorCode");
          if(error != null) {
              errorCode = error.intValue();
              switch(errorCode) {
                  case TIMEOUT_ERROR_CODE:
                      errorMessage = "Login timed out. PLease try again later";
                      break;
                  default:
                      errorMessage = "Something else happened. I don't know what";
              }
              throw new Exception(errorMessage);
          }
      }
 }

See Also:
retrieveAllEvents(), addSnapEventListener(com.nokia.sm.net.SnapEventListener)

TRANSPORT_TIMEOUT_WARNING

public static final int TRANSPORT_TIMEOUT_WARNING
Network timeout warning, thrown when network requests are taking an unusually long time to complete. No specific action required by developer to be taken, just sent to developer code as a notfication.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

TRANSPORT_LISTENER_ERROR

public static final int TRANSPORT_LISTENER_ERROR
Sent when background SNAP event listener thread suffers a non-networking related Exception. Typical causes of this could be Exceptions generated within developer implementations of SnapEventListener.processServerError() or SnapEventListener.processEvents(). Note: the Exception message will be returned as the error message for this warning type

Constructor Detail

ServerComm

public ServerComm(java.lang.String hostname,
                  int port,
                  java.lang.String protocol,
                  int sku)
Create a new ServerComm instance. The new instance will subsequently try to connect to a SNAP Mobile server using the specified parameters. Note: does not try to initialize the network connection automatically (same as calling the other constructor with initNetworking set to false.)

Parameters:
hostname - The name of the host that runs the server
port - The port number on which the the server is listening
protocol - The name of the network protocol to use (for example, "http")
sku - Unique per-device identifier extracted from the game's .jad file.

ServerComm

public ServerComm(java.lang.String hostname,
                  int port,
                  java.lang.String protocol,
                  int sku,
                  boolean initNetworking)
Create a new ServerComm instance. The new instance will subsequently try to connect to a SNAP Mobile server using the specified parameters.

If initNetwork is true, the network layer will be initialized immediately within the constructor. This can cause a network permissions dialog box to be displayed, and can result in an SecurityException being thrown in case the user presses "no" in the dialog, or an IOException being thrown if there is an error connecting. Note: both of these exceptions will be wrapped in RuntimeException before being rethrown by the constructor.

If initNetwork is false, the network will be initialized later when it is first used (typically, upon user login.)

Parameters:
hostname - The name of the host that runs the server
port - The port number on which the the server is listening
protocol - The name of the network protocol to use (for example, "http")
sku - Unique per-device identifier extracted from the game's .jad file.
initNetworking - If true, the network layer is initialized here

getListenLingerMillis

public int getListenLingerMillis()
Gets number of milliseconds listener connection should linger on the server after receipt of a callback message, waiting for "one more" callback message to arrive, before returning.

Returns:
linger milliseconds

setListenLingerMillis

public void setListenLingerMillis(int listenLingerMillis)
Sets number of milliseconds listener connection should linger on the server after receipt of an callback event, waiting for "one more" callback, before returning. Allows receipt of a stream of closely spaced events within the same request, rather than returning immediately after the first event received, and having to reconnect to fetch each additional event.

Default value is -1 (which means the client does not send any value, and the server decides the default linger duration).

Parameters:
listenLingerMillis - number of milliseconds to linger.

getListenMinEvents

public int getListenMinEvents()
Returns minimum number of events the listener should wait receive before returning.

Returns:
min num events

setListenMinEvents

public void setListenMinEvents(int listenMinEvents)
Sets the minimum number of events the listener should wait receive before returning. (Will return if either the min. number of events is received, or if the timeout seconds have expired.)

The default value is 1.

Parameters:
listenMinEvents - min number of events to wait for before returning

getListenTimeOutSeconds

public int getListenTimeOutSeconds()
Number of seconds for which the listener waits to receive events from the server before returning.

Returns:
timeout seconds

setListenTimeOutSeconds

public void setListenTimeOutSeconds(int listenTimeOutSeconds)
Sets the number of seconds for which the listener waits to receive events from the server before returning. The listener will return after either the timeout seconds have expired, or the minimum number of events have been received.

Note: default value is -1, which means the client does not send any value, and the server decides the default linger timeout.

Parameters:
listenTimeOutSeconds - max. number of seconds to wait for events before returning

The API version.

                              java.lang.String presenceAttrs)
Perform unified login for SNAP, IMPS, and Web Services. Same as calling:
extendedLogin( name, password, null, null, gcid, null, null, -1, 1, presenceAttrs, 0, false, null );

See Also:

extendedLogin

                              java.lang.String password,
                              int gcid,
                              java.lang.String presenceAttrs,
                              boolean getMotd)
Perform unified login for SNAP, IMPS, and Web Services. Same as calling:

See Also:

extendedLogin

public ItemList extendedLogin(java.lang.String name,
                              java.lang.String password,
                              java.lang.String auth,
                              java.lang.String handle,
                              int id,
                              java.lang.String token,
                              java.lang.String server,
                              int size,
                              int extendedLogin,
                              java.lang.String presenceAttrs,
                              int policyID,
                              boolean getMotd,
                              java.lang.String locale)
Perform unified login for SNAP, IMPS, and Web Services. In addition to login functionality, this command performs extended functionality such as retrieving the buddy list and setting presence to available all in a single command if extendedLogin=1, otherwise getBuddyList and setPresence has to be called explicitly.

The returned ItemList instance contains the following fields:

Name Type
webSessionID String
impsSessionID String
snapSessionID String
snapUserID String
buddyList Vector
messageList Vector

Each item in the buddyList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
id String
name String
status String

Each item in the messageList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
id Integer
message String

Parameters:
name - Username
password - User password
auth - Authentication name
handle - Handle name
id - Game class ID
token - Link token can be either a hardware ID such as IMEI or a carrier ID
server - Server name
size - length of user property (default is 0)
extendedLogin - Extended LoginView. If set to 1, this command will issue a getBuddyList command and set presence to 'available'.
presenceAttrs - Presence attributes. Can be specified freely by developer for custom game specific purposes. Max length is 128.
policyID - Event policy ID. Defined values are 0 through 3, with 0 as the default.
getMotd - MOTD. If set to 1, this command will get MOTD. MOTD (Message of the day) is returned in messageList.
locale - MOTD locale. Integer value, one of the Symbian locale numbers. Default value is 10 (English).
Returns:
ItemList
See Also:
getBuddyList(), setPresence(int,String)

Perform unified logout from SNAP, IMPS, and Web Services.

Returns:

retrieveAllEvents

public ItemList retrieveAllEvents()
Retrieve all SNAP and IMPS events using default settings. This is equivalent to calling retrieveAllEvents(-1, -1, -1).

The returned ItemList instance contains a callbacks field of type Vector.Each item contained in the callbacks vector is another ItemList instance. Each of these instances contains an id field of type Integer. See the ItemList constants for a defintion of these IDs.

Returns:
ItemList

retrieveAllEvents

public ItemList retrieveAllEvents(int minEvents,
                                  int timeOutSeconds,
                                  int lingerMillis)
Retrieve all SNAP and IMPS events using default settings.

The returned ItemList instance contains a callbacks field of type Vector.Each item contained in the callbacks vector is another ItemList instance. Each of these instances contains an id field of type Integer. See the ItemList constants for a defintion of these IDs.

Parameters:
minEvents - Minimum number of events to wait for before returning results. Default is 1.
timeOutSeconds - Maximum timeout in seconds. Default timeout is 30 seconds.
lingerMillis - Linger period in milliseconds. The linger period is the number of milliseconds to wait for additional events to occur after reaching minEvents, but before reaching timeOutSeconds. This parameter allows additional time for closely grouped events to be returned in the same call, instead of in separate calls.
Returns:
ItemList

gameStart

public ItemList gameStart(java.lang.String lobbyID,
                          int lobbyMaxUsers,
                          java.lang.String gameRoomID,
                          int gameRoomMaxUsers)
Initiate a networked game start.

Same as calling:
gameStart( lobbyID, null, lobbyMaxUsers, -1, gameRoomID, null, gameRoomMaxUsers, -1, -1, -1, 0, -1, null, -1 );

  • lobbyPW is null, which means that there is no password for the lobby.
  • lobbyStatus is -1
  • gameRoomPW is null, which means that there is no password for the game room.
  • gameRoomUserCount is -1
  • gameRoomStatus is -1
  • mode is -1
  • leader is 0
  • timeout is -1
  • presence is null
  • byID is -1

See Also:
gameStart(String,String,int,int,String,String,int,int,int,int,int,int,String,int)

gameStart

public ItemList gameStart(java.lang.String lobbyID,
                          int lobbyMaxUsers,
                          java.lang.String gameRoomID,
                          int gameRoomMaxUsers,
                          int mode,
                          int leader)
Initiate a networked game start.

Same as calling:
gameStart( lobbyID, null, lobbyMaxUsers, -1, gameRoomID, null, gameRoomMaxUsers, -1, -1, mode, leader, -1, null, -1 );

  • lobbyPW is null, which means that there is no password for the lobby.
  • lobbyStatus is -1
  • gameRoomPW is null, which means that there is no password for the game room.
  • gameRoomUserCount is -1
  • gameRoomStatus is -1
  • timeout is -1
  • presence is null
  • byID is -1

See Also:
gameStart(String,String,int,int,String,String,int,int,int,int,int,int,String,int)

gameStart

public ItemList gameStart(java.lang.String lobbyID,
                          java.lang.String lobbyPW,
                          int lobbyMaxUsers,
                          int lobbyStatus,
                          java.lang.String gameRoomID,
                          java.lang.String gameRoomPW,
                          int gameRoomMaxUsers,
                          int gameRoomUserCount,
                          int gameRoomStatus,
                          int mode,
                          int leader,
                          int timeout,
                          java.lang.String presence,
                          int byID)
Initiate a networked game start. This command supports two modes: Join and Challenge.

Join:

  • If the user is already in a gameroom or a lobby different from the target lobby, an error will be generated
  • Set timeout value
  • Create/join lobby if not already created/joined
  • Create/join gameroom if not already created/joined
  • If presence is non-null, set presence as available, and presence attributes to the value of presence

Challenge:

  • If the user is already in a gameroom or a lobby different from the target lobby, an error will be generated
  • Set timeout value
  • Create/join lobby if not already created/joined
  • If leader is true, create a new game room
  • Wait until a match partner is found, or timeout is reached. If timeout occurs, return an error.
  • If presence is non-null, set presence as available, and presence attributes to the value of presence

Note: A rival list is only returned when gameStart is called in Challenge mode. Each item in the rivalList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
userID String
userName String

Each item in the rivalList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
name String

Parameters:
lobbyID - Lobby ID
lobbyPW - Lobby password. This parameter is optional.
lobbyMaxUsers - Max lobby users. This parameter is optional.
lobbyStatus - Lobby status. This parameter is optional.
gameRoomID - Gameroom ID.
gameRoomPW - Gameroom password. This parameter is optional.
gameRoomMaxUsers - Max Gameroom users. This parameter is required for challenge mode.
gameRoomUserCount - Number of Gameroom users. This parameter is optional.
gameRoomStatus - Gameroom status. This parameter is optional.
mode - Mode. 0 for join, 1 for challenge.
leader - Leader. 1 if the client is the leader, 0 otherwise.
timeout - Number of seconds to wait for a match. This parameter is optional.
presence - Presence attributes. This parameter is optional.
byID - When set to 1, lobbyID and gameRoomID are actual IDs. Otherwise they are interpreted as names. The default interpretation is for names. This parameter is optional.
Returns:
ItemList

randomStart

public ItemList randomStart(java.lang.String lobbyID,
                            int lobbyMaxUsers,
                            int gameRoomMaxUsers)
Initiate a random game start using default values for some arguments.

  • If the user is already in a gameroom or a lobby different from the target lobby, an error will be generated
  • Set timeout value
  • Create/join lobby if not already created/joined
  • Look for a suitable gameroom to join. Create a new one if none are available
  • Wait until a match partner is found or timeout is reached. If timeout occurs, return an error.
  • If presence is non-null, set presence as available, and presence attributes to the value of presence

The returned ItemList instance contains the following fields:

Name Type
lobbyID String
gameRoomID String
createdRoom Integer
rivalList Vector

Each item in the rivalList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
userID String
userName String

Parameters:
lobbyID - Lobby ID
lobbyMaxUsers - Max lobby users. This parameter is optional.
gameRoomMaxUsers - Max Gameroom users.
Returns:
ItemList

gameStop

public ItemList gameStop(int gameClassID)
Leave current gameroom and lobby. Optionally also set presence and report scores.

  • If the user is not already in a gameroom, an error will be generated
  • If presence is non-null, set presence as available, and presence attributes to the value of presence
  • For each category[n] that is non-null, report the the associated score entry
  • Leave the current gameroom
  • Leave the current lobby

Parameters:
gameClassID - Game Class ID
Returns:

gameStartCancel

public void gameStartCancel()
Cancel any curently pending matchmaking efforts, such as randomStart() and gameStart(). Can be called out of bounds of another command in progress. Any pending matchmaking command will return a timeout error.

sortStart

public ItemList sortStart(java.lang.String lobbyID,
                          int lobbyMaxUsers,
                          int gameRoomMaxUsers,
                          int sort)
Initiate a networked game start. User will either be put into the game room with fewest users, or into the game room with the most users, depending on the value of the sort paramter. This is a convenience method that calls assumes default values for unspecified arguments.

The returned ItemList instance contains the following fields:

Name Type
lobbyID String
gameRoomID String

Parameters:
lobbyID - Lobby ID
lobbyMaxUsers - Max lobby users. This parameter is optional.
gameRoomMaxUsers - Max Gameroom users. This parameter is required for challenge mode.
sort - When set to 0, put user into game room with fewest users. When set to 1, put user in game room with most users.
Returns:
ItemList

echo

public ItemList echo(int timeoutSeconds,
                     java.lang.String data)
Command for testing network latency and timeouts. When called, SNAP servers will pause for timeout seconds before returning data back to the client. Gateway server timeouts (and other network timeouts) can be tested by repeatedly calling this command with increasing values for timeout, until a timeout threshold is crossed and the network connection is broken with a timeout error.

Parameters:
timeoutSeconds - seconds to pause on server before returning
data - data to be returned
Returns:
ItemList

selectGameRooms

public ItemList selectGameRooms(java.lang.String predicate,
                                int max)
Get a list of gamerooms matching a list of predicates.

Predicates are specified comparing an attribute to a constant value using a relational operator. Attributes are NAME, USER, MAXI, STAT, OID, LOBBY.

  • NAME: A gameroom name
  • USER: The current gameroom user count
  • MAXI: The maximum user quota for the gameroom
  • STAT: A gameroom status
  • OID: The gameroom ID
  • LOBBY: The owning lobby ID

Relational operators are:

  • String operators: .eq., .neq., .gt., .gte., .lt., .lte.,
  • Numeric operators: .=., .!=., .>., .>=., .<., .<=.,
  • Logical operators: .&. with .=. (mask and compare)

Example predicate: NAME.eq.foo MAXI.=.2 USER.<.2

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
gameRoomList Vector

Each item in gameRoomList contains the following fields:

Name Type
id String
name String
numClients Integer
numPlayers Integer
maxUsers Integer
status Integer

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate
max - Maximum number of matches
Returns:
ItemList

selectLobbies

public ItemList selectLobbies(java.lang.String predicate,
                              int max)
Get a list of lobbies matching a list of predicates.

Predicates are specified comparing an attribute to a constant value using a relational operator. Attributes are NAME, USER, MAXI, STAT, OID, LOBBY.

  • NAME: A lobby name
  • USER: The current lobby user count
  • MAXI: The maximum user quota for the lobby
  • STAT: A lobby status
  • OID: The lobby room ID

Relational operators are:

  • String operators: .eq., .neq., .gt., .gte., .lt., .lte.,
  • Numeric operators: .=., .!=., .>., .>=., .<., .<=.,
  • Logical operators: .&. with .=. (mask and compare)

Example predicate: NAME.eq.foo MAXI.=.2 USER.<.2

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
lobbyList Vector

Each item in the lobbyList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
id String
name String
numUsers Integer
numRooms Integer

Parameters:
predicate - Predicate
max - Maximum number of matches
Returns:
ItemList

                            int timeOutSeconds,
                            int lingerMillis)

token - Link token can be either a hardware ID such as an IMEI or a carrier ID
Returns:
ItemList

createUser

public ItemList createUser(java.lang.String username,
                           java.lang.String password,
                           java.lang.String firstName,
                           java.lang.String lastName,
                           java.lang.String email,
                           java.lang.String dateOfBirth,
                           java.lang.String question,
                           java.lang.String answer,
                           java.lang.String operatorId)
Creates a new user. Valid characters allowed:

  • username: alphanumeric and underscores (no spaces)
  • password: all ASCII characters between 32 and 126
  • first name: ASCII 32-126 (optional param, can be null)
  • last name: ASCII 32-126 (optional param, can be null)
  • email: a valid email address (RFC 2822)
  • date of birth: in format: "MM/DD/YYYY"
  • security question: ASCII 32-126
  • security answer: ASCII 32-126
  • operatorId: five or six-digit number

Note: client should restrict number of new users created to max. five per day per handset.

Parameters:
username - Username
password - User password
firstName - User's first name (optional)
lastName - User's last name (optional)
email - User's email address
dateOfBirth - User's date of birth, in format: "MM/DD/YYYY"
question - Security question (optional)
answer - Security answer (optional)
operatorId - Unique six-digit country + operator code (optional)
Returns:
ItemList

retrievePassword

                                 java.lang.String answer)

answer - Security answer

ItemList

listAssets

public ItemList listAssets(int gameClassID,
                           java.lang.String assetClass,
                           java.lang.String userID,
                           java.lang.String comparison,
                           java.lang.String criteria,
                           java.lang.String value,
                           int start,
                           int count)
Returns a list of assets based on search criteria. gameClassID and assetClass are required, all other parameters are optional.

If userID is null, then all assets within the assetClass will be returned (in chunks specified by start and count). If userID is a valid userID, then only the assets belonging to that user will be returned.

To limit the size of the results, start and count may be specified to return only sub-portions of the result list. start is index in the original result list from which to begin the returned sub-listing, and count is the number of results to return, beginning from start.

The comparison operators comparison, criteria, and value are currently not supported.

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
assetList Vector

Each item in the assetList Vector contains the following fields:

Name Type
assetID String
assetLength Integer
isFree Boolean
locale Integer
description String
metaData String

Parameters:
gameClassID - asset's game class ID
assetClass - asset's class
userID - username of asset owner (optional)
comparison - comparison operation (optional)
criteria - comparison criteria (optional)
value - comparison value (optional)
start - index in asset list to begin results. Set to "-1" for default index
count - number of results to return, starting at "start" index. Set to "-1" for default list length.

fetchAsset

public ItemList fetchAsset(int gameClassID,
                           java.lang.String assetClass,
                           java.lang.String userID,
                           java.lang.String assetID)
Returns the specified asset. userID and assetID are optional, and should be supplied in the following cases:

  • One asset per class (e.g., a game logo): userID and assetID should be null.
  • One asset per user (e.g., a user's avatar): userID should be specified, assetID should be null.
  • More than one asset per user (e.g. various weapons belonging to a user): userID and assetID should both be specified.

The return value checksum is used to track asset versions. If the client caches asset data locally, it should record the checksum as well. The client can later check if the asset has changed on the server by sending the checksum via the updateAsset command.

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
gameClassID String
assetClass String
assetID String
description String
metaData String
assetLength Integer
checksum String
assetData (@link byte[])
locale Integer
isFree Boolean
transactionID String

Parameters:
gameClassID - asset's game class ID
assetClass - asset's class
userID - userID of asset owner (optional)
assetID - assetID (optional)

updateAsset

public ItemList updateAsset(int gameClassID,
                            java.lang.String assetClass,
                            java.lang.String userID,
                            java.lang.String assetID,
                            java.lang.String checksum)
UpdateAsset is a mechanism to refresh out-of-date assets that have changed on the server since the last time the client has downloaded them. Each call to fetchAsset returns a value checksum along with the asset data. The checksum can later be sent back to the servers via this command to see if the asset data has changed in the interim. If it has, the results from this call will contain the new asset data, and the new checksum. (The return values in this case will be identical to those from a fetchAsset call. If the asset is up to date, a 992 WebServiceAssetUpToDate error will be returned.

The parameters userID and assetID are optional.

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
gameClassID String
assetClass String
assetID String
description String
metaData String
assetLength Integer
checksum String
assetData (@link byte[])
locale Integer
isFree Boolean
transactionID String

Parameters:
gameClassID - asset's game class ID
assetClass - asset's class
userID - userID of asset owner (optional)
assetID - assetID (optional)
checksum - checksum of client's copy of asset

uploadAsset

public ItemList uploadAsset(int gameClassID,
                            java.lang.String assetClass,
                            java.lang.String assetDescription,
                            java.lang.String assetMetaData,
                            byte[] data,
                            int locale)
Uploads new assets to the server. If successful, the assetID of the new asset is returned. Note: each asset upload results in the creation of a new asset with a new assetID. Existing assets and assetIDs cannot be "replaced" with new data.

The returned ItemList contains the following fields:

Name Type
assetID String

Parameters:
gameClassID - game class ID
assetClass - asset class
assetDescription - plain-language sentence describing the asset (optional)
assetMetaData - meta data about the asset (optional)
data - the asset data itself
locale - locale code (Symbian-based) (optional)

fetchAck

public ItemList fetchAck(int gameClassID,
                         java.lang.String transactionID)
Acknowledgement to the server that an asset has successfully been downloaded via fetchAsset. A successful call to fetchAsset contains the parameter transactionID, which should be extracted and sent verbatim to this method.

By convention, every successful call to fetchAsset should immediately be followed by a call to fetchAck

Parameters:
gameClassID -
transactionID -

requestBuddy

public ItemList requestBuddy(java.lang.String userID,
                             java.lang.String message)
Request to be added as a buddy (or friend).

A number of events may be generated as a result of this call:

  • IMPS_RESULT: Request was passed on to user
  • IMPS_ERROR: Unable to deliver request, for example, because user does not exist
  • IMPS_IM_PRESENCE: Requestor is already on user's buddy list
  • IMPS_BUDDY_ACC_REJ: User accepted or declined request

Parameters:
userID - ID of the user at whom the request is directed
message - A message to accompany the request
Returns:
ItemList

retrieveEvents

public ItemList retrieveEvents(int minEvents,
                               int timeOutSeconds,
                               int lingerMillis)
Retrieve all IMPS events.

The returned ItemList instance contains a callbacks field of type Vector. Each item contained in the callbacks vector is another ItemList instance. Each of these instances contains an id field of type Integer. See the ItemList constants for a definition of these IDs.

Parameters:
minEvents - Minimum number of events to wait for before returning results. Default is 0.
timeOutSeconds - Maximum timeout in seconds. Default timeout is 30 seconds.
lingerMillis - Linger period in milliseconds. The linger period is the number of milliseconds to wait for additional events to occur after reaching minEvents, but before reaching timeOutSeconds. This parameter allows additional time for closely grouped events to be returned in the same call, instead of in separate calls.
Returns:
ItemList

stop

public void stop()
Stops this object and all internally managed threads. This method will block until all internal threads have stopped. This object must not be used again after this method is called.
